Package com.ibm.security.verifysdk

Class NetworkHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.ibm.security.verifysdk.NetworkHandler
  • @RequiresApi(23)
public final class NetworkHandler
extends java.lang.Object
    A singleton class that configures the network objects that handles the calls.
    Version:
    2.1.5

public okhttp3.CertificatePinner getCertificatePinner()

        Returns:
        the CertificatePinner

      • setCertificatePinner

        public void setCertificatePinner​(@Nullable
                                 okhttp3.CertificatePinner certificatePinner)
        Constrains the certificates that are trusted.

        For more information see https://square.github.io/okhttp/3.x/okhttp/okhttp3/CertificatePinner.html

        Parameters:
        certificatePinner - the CertificatePinner for this handler

      • sharedInstance

        public static NetworkHandler sharedInstance()
        Returns the shared defaults object.
        Returns:
        the shared default object

      • setOnPremiseSslParameter

        public void setOnPremiseSslParameter​(@Nullable
                                     javax.net.ssl.SSLContext sslContext,
                                     @Nullable
                                     javax.net.ssl.TrustManager trustManager,
                                     @Nullable
                                     javax.net.ssl.HostnameVerifier hostnameVerifier)
        Sets SSL-specific objects to change the checks to be done for a SSL handshake.

        CAUTION: this should not be used in production environment!

        Parameters:
        sslContext - the SSLContext to use self-signed or unknown certificates for network connections.
        trustManager - the TrustManager to do the SSL certificate checks.
        hostnameVerifier - the HostnameVerifier to use self-signed or unknown certificates for network connections, so that the host name is an acceptable match with the server's authentication scheme.

      • getReadTimeOut

        public int getReadTimeOut()

      • setReadTimeOut

        public void setReadTimeOut​(int readTimeOut)
                    throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Sets the timeout in seconds to read from a connection. The default value is 30 seconds.

        If the timeout is different to the current value, the API handlers for OnPremiseAPI and CloudAPI get re-instanciated.

        Parameters:
        readTimeOut - the timeout in seconds.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if parameter ≤ 0.

      • getConnectionTimeOut

        public int getConnectionTimeOut()

      • setConnectionTimeOut

        public void setConnectionTimeOut​(int connectionTimeOut)
                          throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Sets the timeout in seconds to establish a connection. The default value is 30 seconds.

        If the timeout is different to the current value, the API handlers for OnPremiseAPI and CloudAPI get re-instanciated.

        Parameters:
        connectionTimeOut - the timeout in seconds.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if parameter ≤ 0

      • setRedirectFlags

        public void setRedirectFlags​(boolean followRedirects,
                             boolean followSslRedirects)

      • setLoggingInterceptor

        public void setLoggingInterceptor​(@NonNull
                                  okhttp3.logging.HttpLoggingInterceptor loggingInterceptor)
                           throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Sets the HttpLoggingInterceptor for the underlying OkHttpClient client as described at https://github.com/square/okhttp/tree/master/okhttp-logging-interceptor. If the loggingInterceptor is different to the current value, the API handlers for OnPremiseAPI and CloudAPI get re-instanciated.

        CAUTION: set the log level to HEADER or BODY could leak sensitive information in the logs.

        Parameters:
        loggingInterceptor - the HttpLoggingInterceptor to be used.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if any argument is null.

      • setInterceptor

        public void setInterceptor​(@NonNull
                           okhttp3.Interceptor interceptor)
                    throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Sets the Interceptor for the underlying OkHttpClient client as described at https://square.github.io/okhttp/interceptors/. If the interceptor is different to the current value, the API handlers for OnPremiseAPI and CloudAPI get re-instanciated.

        The primary use case here is to overwrite the 'User-Agent' that is added to the header.

        Parameters:
        interceptor - the Interceptor to be used.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if any argument is null.
        Since:
        2.1.5

      • getHostnameVerifierAcceptAll

        public javax.net.ssl.HostnameVerifier getHostnameVerifierAcceptAll()
        Returns a HostnameVerifier that turns off host name verification (it accepts all host names).

        This implementation is used as a default for connections where OnPremiseAuthenticator.isIgnoreSsl() == true, but can be overridden with setOnPremiseSslParameter(SSLContext, TrustManager, HostnameVerifier).

        CAUTION: this should not be used in production environment!
        Returns:
        the HostnameVerifier

      • getTrustManager

        public javax.net.ssl.TrustManager getTrustManager()
        Returns a TrustManager that trusts all certificates (turns off certificate verification checks).

        This implementation is used as a default for connections where OnPremiseAuthenticator.isIgnoreSsl() == true, but can be overridden with setOnPremiseSslParameter(SSLContext, TrustManager, HostnameVerifier).

        CAUTION: this should not be used in production environment!
        Returns:
        the TrustManager

      • getSslContextTrustAll

        @Nullable
public javax.net.ssl.SSLContext getSslContextTrustAll()
        Returns a SSLContext that trusts all certificates (turns off certificate verification checks).

        This implementation is used as a default for connections where OnPremiseAuthenticator.isIgnoreSsl() == true, but can be overridden with setOnPremiseSslParameter(SSLContext, TrustManager, HostnameVerifier).

        CAUTION: this should not be used in production environment!
        Returns:
        the SSLContext
